result.execSummary:
The defendant Antone J. Lenz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Absolute sobriety from and no possession of controlled substances/alcohol except prescribed medications taken as prescribed and with prior agent authorization.

Sign up for and successfully complete SAFE program or the like.  
AODA and follow through with recommendations. 
Any assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by agent.  
DNA sample. 

No objection to transfer probation to Dane County.  

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

Clerk Marisa. 
Case Called: 1:16 pm 
INCLUDES 19CM1579, 20CM1052, 20CM1262, & 22CF801. 
State appears by ADA Rory McGarry; Deft appears in person, pro se; Agent Bonnie Stoviak appears. 
COURT notes review of report - SAFE assessment has been scheduled. 
Agent notes deft has done everything being asked so far. 
Probation Review set for 11/18/2022 at 1:15 pm.

Probation review hearing on September 16, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief (unsigned)

Clerk Marisa. 
Case Called: 10:29 am 
INCLUDES 19CM1579, 20CM1052, 20CM1262, & 22CF801. 
State appears by ADA Rory McGarry; Deft appears in person, in custody with Atty Oren Jakobson. 
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. VRCW. 

State moves to: 
In 19CM1579: Cts. 3 & 4>>D&RI. 
In 20CM1052: Cts. 1, 3, & 4>>D&RI. 
In 20CM1262: Ct. 1>>D&RI. 
In 22CF801: Cts. 1 & 3-5>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: 
In 19CM1579: Ct. 1 (Misd. Battery)>>GUILTY. 
                     : Ct. 2 (Misd. Battery/DA)>>GUILTY. 
In 20CM1052: Ct. 2 (DC/DA)>>GUILTY. 
In 20CM1262: Ct. 2 (Possess Illegally Obtained Prescription)>>GUILTY. 
In 22CF801: Ct. 2 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia)>>GUILTY. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 

COURT ORDERS: SWH for 2 years probation - CONDITIONS ON ALL: sign up for and successfully complete SAFE program or the like; alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations; assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; absolute sobriety from and no possession of controlled substances/alcohol except prescribed medications taken as prescribed and with prior agent authorization; no violent contact with BLZ;  no contact with any other victims in these files unless authorized by agent; 60 days MCJ and 30 hours CS imposed and STAYED for rule violations; DNA sample/surcharge; CC including 2 DA surcharges. 

COURT finds the def entitled to jail credit as follows: 
In 19CM1579>>2 days. 
In 20CM1052>>3 days. 
In 20CM1262>>NO days. 
In 22CF801>> 27days. 

Probation Review Hrg set for 9/16/2022 at 1:15 pm. 
COURT has no objection to transfer of probation to Dane County. 
Adj: 10:45 am
Jury Trial on September 28, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury status hearing on September 21, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Bail/bond hearing on July 25, 2022 at 10:15 am.
